    • Uses of Project in it.unisa.sesa.repominer.metrics

      Methods in it.unisa.sesa.repominer.metrics with parameters of type Project 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void HistoryMetricsCalculator.calculateMetrics(Project pProject)
      This method calculate project metrics for project passed as argument
      ProjectMetric ProjectMetrics.getBCCMMetric(Project pProject, java.util.Date pPeriodStart, java.util.Date pPeriodEnd)
      This method calculate the value of BCC Metric; it calculates this value only considering changes occurred in time based period between the start and the end date specified in preference panel
      java.util.List<ProjectMetric> ProjectMetrics.getBCCPeriodBased(Project pProject, int periodLength, java.lang.String periodType)
      This method calculate a set of values of BCC Metric; it calculates this values broken the history of changes into equal length periods based on calendar time from the start of the project.
      java.util.List<ProjectMetric> ProjectMetrics.getECCBurstBased(Project pProject, int pEps, int pMinPoints, boolean pIsStatic)
      This method break history into burst based periods and then calculates the value of ECC Model on this periods
      java.util.List<ProjectMetric> ProjectMetrics.getECCModificationBased(Project pProject, int pLimit, boolean pIsStatic)
      This method calculate a set of values of ECC Model using modification limit period based; it calculates this values broken the history of changes into period based on number of modifications specified in preferences panel.
      java.util.List<ProjectMetric> ProjectMetrics.getECCPeriodBased(Project pProject, int pPeriod, java.lang.String periodType, java.lang.Boolean pIsStatic)
      This method calculate a set of values of ECC Model using time based periods method; it calculates this values broken the history of changes into equal length periods based on calendar time from the start of the project.
      ProjectMetric ProjectMetrics.getNumberOfRevision(Project pProject)
      Calculate the NR metric, that represents the system number of revision
